section.p:
cuir ... air bòrd ... puts ... on a table –
Có chuir am bocsa air a’ bhòrd? Chuir Màiri.
Who put the box on the table? Mary did. td. 20
Chuir e an leabhar air a’ bhòrd.
He put the book on the table. td. 47

fàg ... air bòrd ... leaves ... on a table –
An do dh’fhàg thu do leabhar anns an sgoil? Cha do dh’fhàg. Càit an do dh’fhàg thu do leabhar? Dh’fhàg mi mo leabhar air a bhòrd.
Did you leave your book in the school? No, I didn’t. Where did you leave your book? I left my book on the table. td. 48

seas ... aig bòrd ... stands up at a table –
Seas aig a’ bhòrd!
Stand (up) at the window! td. 237
An do sheas e aig a’ bhòrd? Sheas.
Did he stand (up) at the window? Yes, he did. td. 237

suidh ... aig bòrd ... sits down at a table –
Dh’éirich Màiri agus Calum tràth anns a’ mhadainn an diugh, oir bha iad ri dhol do’n sgoil. [...] Dh’éirich athair na cloinne agus màthair na cloinne aig sia uairean sa’ mhadainn. [...] Bha am bracaist ullamh aig cóig mionaidean gu ochd, agus shuidh iad uile aig a’ bhòrd aig ochd uairean.
Mary and Malcolm rose early in the morning today, for they had to go to the school. [...] The children’s father and mother rose at six o’ clock in the morning. [...] Their breakfast was ready at five minutes to eight, and they all sat down at the table at eight o’clock. td. 183

leabhar air bòrd a book on a table –
Tha an leabhar air a’ bhòrd.
The book is on the table. td. 20
Chuir e an leabhar air a’ bhòrd.
He put the book on the table. td. 47
An do dh’fhàg thu do leabhar anns an sgoil? Cha do dh’fhàg. Càit an do dh’fhàg thu do leabhar? Dh’fhàg mi mo leabhar air a bhòrd.
Did you leave your book in the school? No, I didn’t. Where did you leave your book? I left my book on the table. td. 48

bocsa air bòrd a box on a table –
Tha am bocsa air a’ bhòrd. Có chuir am bocsa air a’ bhòrd? Chuir Màiri.
The box is on the table. Who put the box on the table? Mary did. td. 20

bracaist aig bòrd a breakfast at a table –
Dh’éirich Màiri agus Calum tràth anns a’ mhadainn an diugh, oir bha iad ri dhol do’n sgoil. [...] Dh’éirich athair na cloinne agus màthair na cloinne aig sia uairean sa’ mhadainn. [...] Bha am bracaist ullamh aig cóig mionaidean gu ochd, agus shuidh iad uile aig a’ bhòrd aig ochd uairean.
Mary and Malcolm rose early in the morning today, for they had to go to the school. [...] The children’s father and mother rose at six o’ clock in the morning. [...] Their breakfast was ready at five minutes to eight, and they all sat down at the table at eight o’clock. td. 183
